page.title: 17Brackley birds and insects
page.content: Outside our mobile classroom we looked for birds and insects. It is on the edge of the school field next to a bank which has trees down it. In the morning it is very rich with bird life and we saw the following birds. The woodpigeon and starling were hunting for worms. We saw greenfinches, wrens, goldfinches, starlings, chaffinches, blackbirds, blue tits and bullfinches in trees. The jackdaws, swallows and house martins were on the wing and the coots were on the lake. Behind the mobile we also found a lot of insects. Flea beetles were very common (we saw the green and brown varieties). They can jump about 15-20cm high which is surprising as they are only 7mm long. We also saw ants, blue damselflies, sailor beetles, greenfly, ladybirds, daddy-long-legs and snails.
